title: How to Play Call of Duty Mobile on PC With GameLoop Emulator

steps.title: Go to GameLoop's website.
steps.content: Go to GameLoop's website. GameLoop is the official emulator for Call of Duty: Mobile. Anecdotal reports state that using Bluestacks or any other mobile emulator will get you banned, so if you want to play on PC, it's recommended to use GameLoop. Note that you must have at least a Windows 8 or Windows 10 64-bit operating system with at least a NVIDIA GTX 660 GPU, Intel i3-9320 CPU, 8GB RAM, and 20MB storage space available to play CoD: Mobile on your PC.

steps.title: Click Download in the top right corner.
steps.content: Click Download in the top right corner. Save the file to your desktop or downloads folder, or somewhere else that you can access easily.

steps.title: Run the GameLoop exe file to install it.
steps.content: Run the GameLoop exe file to install it. Follow the on-screen instructions to install GameLoop to your PC.

steps.title: Open GameLoop and search for Call of Duty Mobile in the search bar.
steps.content: Open GameLoop and search for Call of Duty Mobile in the search bar. You'll have to install CoD: Mobile via GameLoop to play it on your PC.

steps.title: Tap the Install button.
steps.content: Tap the Install button. The game will begin to install. [1] X Research source Once the installation is complete, you can boot CoD Mobile and start playing on your PC. You'll have to login to your Activision account once you boot the game if you'd like to continue playing on the same account.

steps.title: There are other emulators, but they can get you banned.
steps.content: There are other emulators, but they can get you banned. There are other mobile emulators, such as BlueStacks and NoxPlayer, but CoD: Mobile players should avoid these emulators for this game. Many users have reported that using any other emulator besides GameLoop will result in a ban. Some users have stated they were banned within minutes of playing the game on BlueStacks. This is anecdotal evidence, and not all of the bans seem to be permanent. However, to avoid the risk of losing your account, it's safer to stick with GameLoop.

steps.title: You could use screen mirroring apps, but they're laggy.
steps.content: You could use screen mirroring apps, but they're laggy. Some users have tried to use screen mirroring apps (that mirror your phone screen on your computer) such as scrcpy or qtscrcpy. While these apps likely won't get you banned on CoD: Mobile, users that have tried them state that the controls are somewhat limited and there is a lot of input lag, which makes the game difficult (or potentially even impossible) to play. For the best playing experience, it's best to stick with GameLoop.
